alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 17 at 3:22AM PST until December 19 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW POSSIBLE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... .A winter storm will spread snow into the Cascades Friday night with snow becoming heavy Saturday morning through Saturday night. Travel will be difficult over Stevens Pass with this winter storm. Snow is expected to decrease by late Sunday morning. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 15 and 25 inches possible. * WHERE...Holden Village and Stevens Pass. * WHEN...From this evening through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Persons should consider delaying all travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
